citation.article-title: Phylogenetic relationships of three amino-acid-utilizing anaerobes, Selenomonas acidaminovorans, 'Selenomonas acidaminophila' and Eubacterium acidaminophilum, as inferred from partial 16S rDNA nucleotide sequences and proposal of Thermanaerovibrio acidaminovorans gen. nov., comb. nov. and Anaeromusa acidaminophila gen. nov., comb. nov.

p.s: Thermanaerovibrio (Therm.an.ae.ro.vib'ri.o. Gr . adj. thermos hot; Gr. pref. an not; Gr. n. aer air; M.L. masc. n. vibrio that vibrates; M.L. masc. n. Thermanaerovibrio a thermophilic vibrating anaerobe)
Strictly anaerobic curved cells with rounded ends.
The type species is Thermanaerovibrio acidaminovorans comb. nov.
